data.title: Winners of 2021 Quebec Music Competition
meta_keywords: Winners of 2021 Quebec International Music Competition
data.meta_description: Winners of 2021 Quebec International Music Competition
data.meta_site_name: Quebec  Music Competition - National and International Music Competition for all ages and levels
data.text:
Tomoko Takada Otakeguchi - HARP - Platinum Medalist - Japan

Born in Japan, She graduated from Nagoya University of Arts with a Bachelor of Music degree and received the Golden Prize from the same university. She was awarded the 2012 Aichi Prefectural University of Fine Arts and Music Outstanding Student Award, and paid a courtesy call on the governor of Aichi Prefecture as a university representative.

She has studied with Emmanuel Ceysson, Elisabeth Fontan-Binoche, Marie-Pierre Langrame, JanaBoušková, Isabelle Perrin and others at the NICE International Academy of Music (France), the Prague Academy of Arts (Czech Republic) and the Svizzera Italiana Conservatory (Switzerland), and performed in concerts with the best graduates. Diploma.

Tomoko has won the following awards, including: The 71st Fukui Prefecture Music Competition, 1st Prize and Governor's Prize, The 9th Gifu International Music Competition, 1st prize in the string section; Gold Prize and Grand Prize in the String Section of the 13th Kyushu Music Competition; The 6th Tateshina Music Competition for Strings, Highest Prize; The 5th Yokohama International Music Competition, Strings Section, First Prize; 18th KOBE International Music Competition for Strings, Excellent Prize and Kobe City Board of Education Prize;The 16th Osaka International Music Competition, 2nd Prize (the highest Japanese prize); The 25th Japan Harp Competition, International Professional Division, 4th Prize; MUSIC & STARS AWARDS 1st Prize Golden Star Prize (Estonia); 4th Poppy Harp Festival 1st Prize for Best Overall Performance (England); 2021 Grand Metropolitan International Music Competition 1st Prize Platinum Prize (Montreal); 2021 Grand Prize Virtuoso International Music Competition, 1st prize (London); 2022 First Prize in the 2nd ISCART International Music Competition -Scholarship ex-aequo (Switzerland);

International Moscow Music Competition 1st Prize (Russia); Platinum prize at the 5th Edition Quebec Music Competition (Canada). In 2019, she was awarded a grant from the Aichi Bank Foundation for Education and Culture (Aichi Bank) for the first year of 2019.

In 2015, she performed the Japan premiere of Lei Liang's harp concerto with the orchestra of Aichi Prefectural University of Fine Arts and Music at the University of California, San Diego's "Methodology of the Diverse Age - Composition Concert UCSD⇔AUA Composers Concert". In 2016, she performed a concerto by G. Pierné with the Nagoya Philharmonic Orchestra in the "Orchestra Series" organized by the Agency for Cultural Affairs.

Diana Schnürpel - Voice - Platinum Medalist - Grand Champion of 2021 Quebec Music Competition - Germany

​​

Diana Schnürpel & Jan Doormann - Clarvoice Duo - Platinum Medalist - Germany

Diana Schnürpel was born into a musical family. In 2001, she graduated with distinction in piano and began singing studies at the Choral Academy in Moscow with the opera singer

Nina Rautio. She then studied opera singing at the “Felix Mendelssohn Bartholdy” University of Music and Theatre in Leipzig with Regina Werner-Dietrich. Schnürpel made her stage debut in Germany with the role of the Bride in Les Noces by Igor Stravinsky at the Ruhr Piano Festival in Duisburg in July 2013. Afterwards she sang the part of the Queen of the Night on the Magic Flute in numerous houses. For the roles Gepopo in György Ligeti’s Le Grande Macabre and the title role of Maria Stuarda by Gaetano Donizetti, she received attention in the 2016/2017 and 2017/2018 seasons, and her great and unique coloration combined with the warm sound of her voice was attested. Since January she has also been playing with Jan

Doormann.

Jan Doormann was born in Braunschweig, Germany and began his clarinet studies in 1988 with Georg Zeretzlke at the "Hochschule der Künste" in Berlin. Since 1 990, he has been the principal clarinetist of the Staatskapelle Weimar. He has made numerous appearances as a soloist with this orchestra and with the Thuringian Chamber Orchestra. With these orchestras and with the ensemble "Tritonus Wimare," he has recorded many CDs as an orchestral and chamber music player. Doorman is also committed to teaching music. He is

an instructor at the Hochschule für Musik "Franz Liszt, in Weimar and has served as lecturer for various orchestral courses. In addition, he is a co-founder of and lecturer at the "Norddeutsche Klarinettentage ;North German Days) in Bremen and appears regularly various chamber music ensembles and elsewhere in Europe. Chamber music since January 2019 he also with Diana Schnürpel.

Dan Qiao - Violin - Platinum Medalist - USA

Dan Qiao has enjoyed a vibrant career as a violinist performing in concerts around the world, including in China, Europe, and the USA. After starting violin at age 4, She graduated from Central Conservatory of Music in Beijing(MM). In 2015, she moved to the USA to study at the College-Conservatory of Music, University of Cincinnati (MM,DMA).

Ms. Qiao has performed as a solo and chamber musician at such prestigious festivals as the Beijing Modern Music Festival, Mostly Modern music festival, Euro Music Festival, Rencontres Musicales Internationales des Graves, and Jubilee International Music Course, Lunigiana International Music Festival, Brevard Music Festival. She played a chamber music concert with legendary violinist Maxim Vengerov at Rencontres Musicales Internationales des Graves in 2019.

Dan has received many honors and awards for her work, including 1st prize in chamber music at the Beijing International Harp Music Festival, honorable Mention Winner of a Doug Davis Endowment Performance Award, 1st place at Three Arts Scholarship Competition, and a multi-time winner of the CCM concerto competition.

Ocimar Correa Filho - Violin - Platinum Medalist - Austria

Brazilian violinist based in Austria, is currently studying at the University of Music and Performing Arts Graz. He has won prizes and awards in competitions, including the British Music Society Prize.

Daniel Kuzuhara - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

​​Daniel Kuzuhara is a pianist born in Madison, Wisconsin who graduated with a master’s degree in Piano Performance from the Indiana University Jacobs School of Music, studying under Dr. Karen Shaw. Prior to his studies in Indiana, he studied under Professor Anthony Padilla at Lawrence University, Julie Chang, and Karen Hill.

Throughout his career, Daniel has received multiple awards and honors. Most recently, he won 1st prize (platinum medal) at the 2021 Quebec International Music Competition, 1st prize (gold medal) at the 2021 Grand Metropolitan International Music Competition, 2nd place in the 2021 Music International Grand Prix, 2nd place in the 2013 Schubert Club Scholarship competition, and 3rd prize at the 2021 Moscow International Music Competition. He also won the 2011 Neale-Silva competition sponsored by Wisconsin Public Radio and was featured in a live performance on WPR

Carmelo Di Girolamo - Piano (Pop) - Platinum Medalist - Italy

Jerome (Carmelo Di Girolamo) graduated brilliantly from IMP G. Braga

and subsequently obtained two degrees in Piano and Chamber Music

in the same institute with honors, plus a “reading of the score” diploma on Pescara conservatory.

He continued his studies in Europe by participating in high-level

masterclasses that led him to obtain prizes and awards in various

international competitions and events such as in Bacau in the Chopin

Competition and in Germany at the Hochschule Academy in Aachen.

Jerome is stimulated by a continuous musical research and never

stops: as he is a ballet pianist, he is called to collaborate with the Royal Academy of Dance.

Just the combination of these two arts, music and dance, creates the

basis for the realization of relevant international collaborations, from Europe to USA. In 2021 he won the first prize at Canadian International Music Competition with his piece Breathe, Right Now, as a composer and Pop pianist. He was selected with his piece “Adage” for the Italian Film Sets Festival SEOUL 2020 (KOREA). There’s no shortage of TV experiences: he was a guest in the Tv show GUESS MY AGE 2020. For over ten years he has carried out significant teaching activities in Academies and Schools. Today he is a Professor of music education, composition and production at High School VIRGILIO and pianist teacher at REC Academy (Milan).

Sebastian Gobbels - Harp - Platinum Medalist - Canada

Hailed from Aurora, Ontario, Canada, aspiring eighteen year old Sebastian Gobbels has pursued his musical dreams since the age of seven.

For the past three seasons Sebastian has performed as principal harp for the Toronto Symphony Youth Orchestra as well as the Toronto Youth Wind Orchestra, and the Richmond Hill Philharmonic Orchestra. He was featured as a soloist to perform the Handel Harp Concerto in B Flat with the Metropolitan Winds of Toronto.

In the summer of 2019 Sebastian was selected to be one of the 15 harpists worldwide to attend the Summerfest Harp Colony at the renowned Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia. As well, he participated in the Young Artist Harp Seminar at Kenyon College in Ohio.

In 2020 Sebastian was the recipient of three Gold Awards for Harp solos in the International Music Festival and Competition (CDN) and obtained First Prize in the Concerto for Harp and Orchestra. In early 2021 Sebastian was awarded First Place in the Elite International Musical Competition for his performance of the Houdy Sonata.

Having obtained First Class Honours for his Royal Conservatory of Music ARCT Harp Diploma examination, Sebastian is currently pursuing a Bachelor of Music in Harp Performance at the Peabody Institute, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, under the tutelage of Professor June Han. In the summer of 2021 Sebastian will enjoy his first season with the National Youth Orchestra of Canada and the Bowdoin Music Festival.

Bruce Leto Jr. - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

As a prize-winner in scholastic (Dora Khyatt); Collegiate (Bi-Co Concerto Competition); national (Seattle International Virtuoso Artists Festival); and international (Quebec Music Competition; Canadian International; VI Odin - EAAE Affiliate) piano adjudications - Bruce's music tenure has enabled him to perform in PA, NJ, FL, NY, and Italy. In 2021, Bruce received 1st Prize in the Grand Metropolitan International Music Competition (Professional Division - Piano) - successfully winning his first-ever professional division as a soloist. Previously, Bruce received 3rd Prize in the Four-Hands category of the VI Odin International Music Competition with ensemble partner Scott Cohen; 3rd Prize in the National West Chester Piano Competition; 2nd Prize in the Seattle International Piano Festival - Virtuoso Artists 2020; 1st Prize - Platinum in the 2021 Quebec International Music Competition (Professional Division); Finalist Placing with Special Recognition- Championoing the Music of Charles and Curt Cacioppo (Judge's Citation) via the highly competitive The American Prize competition (Professional Division, Solo); recognition via the World Piano Teachers Association (IPC Finland - 2020) Honorable Mention ; and, 1st Prize Platinum with Cohen in the Ensemble Category of the Canadian International Online Music Competition. During his collegiate years, Bruce's piano study under Linda de Pasquale and Curtis Cacioppo led to acceptance at the Chautauqua Music Festival and the Orfeo International Music Festival - where he studied in 2011. Presently, he studies under Scott Cohen on a performance-based scholarship at the Cohen School of Music.

​

Bruce's playing has been described as "kaleidoscopic," "refined," "intelligent," "poetic," "lyrical," and "highly skilled" by piano department chairs of music schools, critically-acclaimed international pianists, professional review outlets such as Take Effect,Fanfare, and Artisan Music Reviews and Navona-affiliated composers. He has been featured in masterclasses with concert artists such as: Steven Mayer, Riccardo Piacentini, Veda Zuponcic, and Leon Bates!

"[In Seasonal Sonorities] Bruce demonstrates an impressive ability to interpret music from different eras, from romantic to impressionist, to 21st century." - David Carpenter, Composer (Navona Records)

"Played with great care and sensitivity...Bruce Leto is an intelligent and highly-skilled musician." - Charles Abramovic, Department Chair Piano Studies (Temple University)

In 2020, Bruce released a CD ("GOMITOLO! An Interpreter's Tribute to a COVID-Stricken Europe") with Navona records, which received a Silver Medal at the Global Music Awards in 2021! In May 2021, Bruce's CD "Singing Style" - released with Albany Records - received airplay via WRTI 90.1 Classical, and reviews from Fanfare Magazine!

Kitsho Hosotani - Violin - Platinum Medalist - USA

Kitsho Hosotani, born in America in 2000, began studying the violin at age 4. He has performed with the Fox Valley Symphony Orchestra, Northeastern Illinois University String Orchestra, Harper Symphony Orchestra, and Oistrakh Symphony Orchestra. He has won prizes in the Thirteen Annual DePaul Concerto Festival for Young Performers, Robert Stanger Young Artists Concerto Competition, and

American Music Institute Violin Competition. He was in the semifinals of the 2020 William C. Bryd Young Artist Competition and the finals of the 2020 International Anton Rubenstein Competition. This year, he won third prize in the strings category of the Tuesday Musical Scholarship Competition.

Jacky Leung - Alto Saxophone - Platinum Medalist - Hong Kong

Composition - Gold Medalist

Jacky Leung is the first prize winner of the 2020/2021 International Music Competition in Germany & Canada.

Jacky had made tours and given performances and masterclasses in many universities and international events. In 2017, he was the jury member of the Elbe Valley International Music Festival. From 2019, Jacky had won the 2nd and 3rd prize in the Concerto competition & Solo Wind Instrument category of the 20th Osaka International Music Competition (the only Hong Kong saxophonist who received this award) and until 2021, he has accumulated 7 first prizes &

numerous other prizes in Germany, Canada, Japan etc. Jacky also performed with many worldwide renowned artists and all his compositions got high acclaims.

Jacky is currently the Music Director of the Music Children Foundation, Vice Chairman of the Hong Kong International Single Reed Association and freelance saxophonist of the Hong Kong Philharmonic Orchestra and the Hong Kong Sinfonietta. Jacky is also a Vandoren (Paris) artist.

Skyler Chan and Oliver Chan - Piano Duo - Platinum Medalists - USA

As natives of Minneapolis, Minnesota, the siblings Skyler Chan (17 years old), and Oliver Chan (14 years old) were solo artists before they started to play as a Duo.

Currently, they study with Dr. Kyung Kim (Chair of Keyboard Division, Associate Professor of Piano, University of Minnesota School of Music) after studying with Professor Alexander Braginsky since the age of four years old. As solo and duet artists, Skyler and Oliver performed at numerous venues and recently won 1 st Prize at the VIVO International Music Competition, 1 st Prize at Enkor International Music Competition, 1 st Place at The King’s Peak International Music Competition, and absolute 1 st Prize at The Danubia International Music Competition, as a Piano Duo in 2020-2021. In addition, they were 2 nd Prize winners at the Odin

International Music Competition in 2021. In 2017, Skyler was First Prize Winner at the Bradshaw & Buono International Competition (where he performed at Carnegie Hall). In 2018, Skyler won First Prize at both the Ohio International Piano Duet & Duo Competition and the North West International Piano Ensemble Competition in Vancouver. In 2019, Skyler was the 1 st Place Winner in the Schubert Club Competition, which led to his debut at the

Ordway Theater in St. Paul, Minnesota. In 2018, Oliver won 3 rd Place at the Carmel Klavier International Piano Competition for Young Artists. In the same year, Oliver was the 1 st Prize winner at the University of Northwestern Piano Solo Festival. In 2017, Oliver was selected to have a Master Class with Antonio Pompa Baldi at the e-Piano Junior Festival. In 2016, he won First Prize at the Piano Fun competition.

Eric Yun - Piano & Violin - Platinum - USA

Eric Yun is a Junior at Okemos High School in Okemos, Michigan, USA. He began taking violin lessons at the age of four and started taking piano lessons a year later. He has received awards in various music competitions for both instruments. He won first place at the MMTA State Piano Competition, second place at the Carmel Klavier International Piano Competition, and earned the Most Distinguished Musician with a Young Talent Special Mention at the IBLA Grand Prize. In December 2019, he debuted at Carnegie Hall’s Weill Recital Hall as a first-place winner of the American Protégé International Competition of Romantic Music. He had his orchestra debut with the Mason Symphony Orchestra in March 2020. He was concertmaster of MSBOA’s 2020 All State High School Orchestra. Eric studies piano with Prof. Derek Polischuk and violin with Prof. I-Fu Wang at Michigan State University.

Wenjia Rao - Piano - Platinum Medalist - China

Wenjia Rao, started studying piano at age 7. In year 2019, she started Master of Performance in Royal College of Music and studied with Professor Gordon-Fergus- Thompson. In year 2014, she started Bachelor of Music in Royal Northern College of Music with entrance scholarship and studied with Professor Stephen Savage and Paul Janes. In year 2011 she started studying in high school associated to Shanghai Conservatoire and studied with Professor William Chen. In year 2007 she started studying in primary and junior school associated to Wuhan Conservatoire and studied with Professor Xiaofeng Zheng. She has held many solo and chamber music concerts during her student life, such as in Manchester Cathedral, St. Ann Church, St Mary Abbots, etc. and was successfully holding a charity concert in Manchester for donation to a Manchester fellowship in the year 2018. In 2021, she was awarded the second prize of Poland “art and life” foundation music completion Section piano Category D.

William Huang - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

William Huang is a sophomore at Palos Verdes Peninsula High School. William began playing piano at the age of 5 and has studied with Lilit Babayan and Dr. Janet Favreau. He currently is under the tutelage of Rufus Choi. His musical achievements include top prizes in competitions such as the CAPMT Concerto Competition, MTAC Piano Concerto Competition, Scholarship Auditions, and the Bach Complete Works Auditions. Most recently, he was selected as a first prize winner of the American Protégé Concerto Competition and was invited to perform at Carnegie Hall. He is also a first prize winner of the Great Composers Competition, first and cash prize winner of the Prima Volta Music Competition, and first prize winner of the Rotary Instrumentalist Competition. Besides music, William loves to play tennis and participate in his various extracurricular activities of which he has received national recognition.

Julia Jones - Violin - Platinum Medalist - USA

Julia Jones is 17-year old violinist from New York City. She started violin lessons with Viktor Basis at the age of 5 at the Kaufman Music Center.

At the early age Julia became a top prize winner of many national and international competitions. First Prize at the Cremona International Competition, in 2016, semi-finalist of the 8th International Spohr Competition, Grand Prize at the 4th ENKOR International Competition, Bronze Winner at the National MTNA Competition.

As a winner of the Kaufman Music Center Concerto Competition, Julia performed with orchestra at Merkin Hall in 2018, conducted by N.Hetherington, she performed Sibelius Violin Concerto with Park Avenue Chamber Symphony under conductor D.Bernard. Julia was invited to perform Bach Double Violin Concerto with European Youth Spirit Orchestra(EYSO), conductor Igor Kuret. In 2018 Julia joined The Perlman Music Program. Currently Julia is under mentorship of Viktor Tretiakov and Natalia Likhopoi

Athanasios Kyparos - Violin - Platinum - Greece

Athanasios Kyparos was born in Thessaloniki, Greece in 2007 and is a student of Thessaloniki State Conservatory, under the supervision of Professor Georgios Petropoulos.

He is a first prize winner of several International Music Competitions, such as “Golden Classical Music Awards” (New York, 2021), “Grand Prize Virtuoso” (Paris, 2020), “International Youth Music Competition (Atlanta USA, 2021), “Online Wave” (Spain, 2020, 2021). He is the Grand Prix winner at “Spring in London” First International Competition

of Music and Arts (United Kingdom, 2021), a Grand Prize winner (Platinum Diploma, grade 100/100) at “World Art Games” Fiestalonia Milenio International Contest (Spain, 2021), and recently a Platinum Medal winner at Quebec Music Competition (Canada, 2021). Athanasios has featured as a soloist in various venues, as Wiener Saal Mozarteum,

Salzburg (Austria), Thessaloniki Concert Hall (Greece), and is selected to feature as a soloist in Weill Recital Hall, at Carnegie Hall, New York, in Winners Concert and Awards Ceremony of the “Golden Classical Music Awards” Competition”, at 2022 Season Debut.

Vjera Radulović - Violin - Platinum Medalist - Montenegro

My name is Vjera Radulović and I am from Montenegro. I’m 16 years old and I’ve been playing the violin since I was 7. I’ve won many awards on national and international music competitions, such as Platinum award on National Montenegrin Music competition and Laureate on International Music competition in Croatia. I’ve performed on many concerts and festivals such as KotorArt, and my solo concert will be organized this June. The Platinum award that I’ve won on Quebec Music competiton means a lot to me. I am honored to know that among so many talented young musicians from all over the world, I got amazing results.

Chen Hu Jie - Clarinet - Platinum Medalist - China

Chen Hu Jie. Chinese clarinetist, composer, chamber musician. The Music

Director of Soundshadow Ensemble. Yichang Gorges Symphony Orchestra Guest Principle Clarinet. As a soloist, Chen Hu Jie made series clarinet concerts “Loop Line” and “Time Shuttle” since 2018. As a chamber musician, in 2019, he founded Soundshadow Ensemble as Music Director. He was hired by Yichang Gorges Symphony Orchestra (YGSO) when he was only 19 years old. He won the first prize in the 5 th China National Music Competition of Woodwind and Brass (clarinet) and honored with China “Small GoldBell” Special Honor Music Prize (China, 2016); Platinum Prize in the 5 th Concours de musique Québec (Canada, 2021). Chen Hu Jie born in Yichang, China in 1999. His teachers included Finnish Radio Symphony Orchestra Principle Clarinet Christoffer Sundqvist, Swedish Clarinetist Emil Jonason, Pre-Principle Clarinet of Military Band of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Yu Bo, American Clarinetists Robert Spring and Joshua Gardner.

Anna Vienna Ho - Piano - Platinum - United Kingdom

Born in Hong Kong, Anna Vienna Ho is a versatile musician who has worked professionally

as a solo pianist, piano accompanist, répétiteur and composer. She has worked with many opera companies and music organizations, including Welsh National Opera, Birmingham Opera Company, Tête à Tête Opera Festival, Opera Novella, London Oriana Choir and London Gay Symphony Orchestra, among others. She has given solo recitals and performed in various concert venues in Asia and Europe, including Royal Albert Hall, Birmingham Town Hall, Parco della Musica and Hong Kong City Hall. Anna gained an Advanced Postgraduate Diploma and her Master of Music in Piano Performance with distinction from Royal Birmingham Conservatoire, where she received a number of awards and scholarships. She was a first-prizewinner of numerous international competitions, including the International Robert Schumann Klavier Welttbert, Internationaler Deutscher Irmler-Klavierwettbewerb, Rome International Music Competition, 5th Propiano International Competition, International Moscow Music Online-Competition, the Montpelier Arts Center Classical Recital Competition and Abergavenny Eisteddfod Y Fenni, and others

Kelly Kim - Violin - Platinum Medal - USA

Kelly Kim (17), is a junior at the Glenbrook North High School Academy in Northbrook. She attends the Academy of the Music Institute of Chicago and currently studies with Almita Vamos. She was the concertmistress for the CYSO’s Philharmonic, Debut, and Concert Orchestras as well as Preparatory Strings. She was selected to be in the district-wide orchestra (ILMEA) as assistant concertmaster and was selected as principal second violin for the state-wide orchestra. She has also won various prizes and recognitions in competitions including the Granquist Competition (2012, 2013), the Chicago International Music Association Competition (2014), the INPASS Music Competition (2011), the Festival in Honor of Confucius (2015, 2017), the Society of American Musicians Competition (2017, 2018, 2021), the Chicago Youth Symphony Orchestra Concerto Competition (2018), the Sejong Music Competition (2020), the Depaul Concerto Festival Competition (2019, 2020, 2021), and the Glenbrook Symphony Orchestra Concerto Competition (2019, 2021).

Nicole Izaguirre - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

Born in Barcelona, Spain 15-year-old pianist Nicole Izaguirre moved to the U.S with her family at the age of 6 months old. At the age of 4 years old Nicole started playing the piano at Bradley University Pre-college division under the direction of Artistic Director Mrs. Ana Nogaj in Peoria, IL. At the age of 5 years old she won 2 nd place at Granquist Memorial Music Competition in Geneva, IL. She was alsoawarded with 2 nd place at the same competition at the age of 6 years old. In 2011she won first place at the Bradley Grade School Piano Competition. Nicole moved to NJ with her family in 2012 where she continued lessons with Dr. Min Kwon and Mrs. Soeyon Park. Nicole received Honorable Mention at the IVC in 2016 and she

was encouraged by her teacher to audition to Mannes School of Music. Nicole started at Mannes School of Music under the direction of Dr. Vladimir Valjaveric and won 3th Prize at the IGMC in NYC which gave her the opportunity to perform at Merkin Hall in 2016. Nicole also won 1 st place at the Rondo Young Artist Competition and had her first appearance at Carnegie Hall in 2017. She won Silver Prize at the 2017 IVC. Honorable Mention at Piano Accolades Competition at Mannes School of Music in 2017. In 2018 she won 2 nd Place at the Rondo Young Artist Competition and she performed at the Scandinavian House. In 2018 she was awarded with Gold at the IVC in NJ and Pre-Senior Winner at the Accolades Piano Competition in Mannes. She also was invited to perform at the Steinway Hall in 2017 and 2018. Invited Guest at First Presbyterian Church in New Vernon, NJ in 2017, 18. She was finalist at the Steinway Competition in 2018. She continued her piano studies in the Honors Program at Mannes School of Music under the direction of Lora Tchekoratova. On Nov. 2020 Nicole was introduce by the Center for Musical Excellence (CME) on a live Zoom concert where people all over the world tune in to enjoy Nicole’s performance. 2021 First Prize winner at

Charleston International Music Competition. Currently, Nicole studies with CME founder & Artistic Director Dr. Min Kwon.

Samuel Solomon - Guitar - Platinum Medalist - Bulgaria

Samuel Solomon was born on 07-Jan-2009. He started learning classical guitar at the age of 7. Currently he is student in Koblenz International Guitar Academy, Germany in the class of prof. Hubert Kaeppel and in National School of Music "Lyubomir Pipkov" in Sofia, Bulgaria in the class of Hristo Neshev. Samuel won numerous of International Competition among which: First places on Altamira Gorizia Guitar Competition 2020 – in First (up to 12 years old) and Second (up to 14 years old) age groups. First Place in First Age group on the Rust International Guitar Competition. First places on 21-st Szeged International Guitar Festival, Hungary, 2020, I st category up to 12 years and II nd category up to 14 years old. First absolute prize on Florence Guitar Competition 2020. First place on Transylvania Guitar Competition. First place on 5-th Zagreb Guitar Festival, Croatia, 2019 First place on Tremolo

Gutar Festival 2018 in age group up to 9 years old and First place in group up to 11 years old; First place on ХХІI International Guitar Competition Kyustendil; Akad. Marin Goleminov; 2018, I st category, up to 10 years and won special prize of Darik Radio First place on International Pleven Guitar Fetsival 2018, 2019 First place on the 6th edition of the Thessaloniki International Guitar Festival, Greece 2019 First place on “Golden classical music awards” New York, 2018, String category, up to 8 years old and was invited to play in Carnegie Hall First place on "Grand Prize Virtuoso" Zsalzburg, Austria, 2017, String category, up to 8 years old and was invited to play in Mozarteum hall. He also won special prize "Exceptional Young Musician" First place on IX International Music

Competition 2018, 2019, 2020 Belgrade, Serbia Second place on Altamira Guitar Competition, group up to 12 years old, First place on Muse International Music Competition, Greece, 2019 and 2020 and as part of prizes Samuel recorded CD.

David Lee - Violin - Platinum Medalist - South Korea

David had won awards in prestigious competitions such as 3rd in South Korean nationwide MyContest Universal Harmony Concours, 1st prize in American Protege International Concerto Competition with a solo performance in Carnegie Hall held in 2022 summer, 1st place in 21st Seoul National Student Music Scholarship Competition, 3rd prize in Charleston International Baroque Competition, Grand Prix Winner in New York Concert Festival Spring International Competition, Winner of New York Concert Festival Concerto Competition, International Russian Silk Way Competition 3rd prize with solo recital held with Tchaikovsky Orchestra conducted by Sergei Luran in Moscow, Russia in 2021 summer and International Ars Astra Music Competition 1st prize.

Murphy Chuang - Cello - Gold Medalist - Taiwan

Born in Taiwan, Murphy Chuang has been studying the cello

since the age of seven under Chia-Ming Hsu and Wei-Ting Hung

and is currently studying in Massachusetts, USA. She has taken

part in several orchestras such as New England Conservatory of

Music Preparatory School (NEC-Youth Repertory Orchestra),

Taipei Philharmonic Youth Ensemble (TPYE), and Milton

Academy School Orchestra. Over the past few years, Murphy

has participated and won in numerous local and international

competitions including Gold Award in “2021 Canada Grand

Metropolitan International Music Competition” Final Round; Gold

Award in "2020 Japan Osaka International Music Competition”

Section III Junior Course; Champion in “2020 Tokyo International Youth Music Competition 2020” Preliminary round; 2nd Place in “Hong Kong International Fringe Association (IFA) International Music Talent Online Competition 2020” Open Class (Strings); Silver Award in “2019 Brilliant

Talent Discovery Awards International Music Competition” and was invited to perform in the Gala Concert at The Esplanade Recital Hall, Singapore.

Murphy has been raising funds for “Sistema Taiwan” through charity recitals since 2020 to help underprivileged children in practicing music. She continues to pursue her passion for cello and music.

Jeffrey Kautz - Percussion - Gold Medalist - USA

Award-Winning Solo Timpanist Jeffrey Kautz is very passionate and moved by the timpani. Jeffrey attained a Master of Music degree from NYU Steinhardt and a Bachelor of Music from Mannes School of Music. Jeffrey is currently Timpanist of the Massapequa Philharmonic, New Jersey Sinfonietta, Amore Opera Orchestra and the Apotheosis Opera Orchestra. He is also currently a Percussionist of the South Shore Symphony Orchestra and was an Actor Drummer on the HBO Series Plot Against America.

Mr. Kautz has won over 20 prizes and awards in competitions as a solo timpanist. Among the prizes are: Winner of the Mannes Concerto Competition, Winner of the Philadelphia International Music Festival Concerto Competition, and First Prize in the New York International Percussion Competition. During the Pandemic, Jeffrey successfully competed in many international competitions hosted by cities such as: Singapore, Quebec, Salzburg, Bonn, Hong Kong, and New York.

Carmen Yee Sing Ying - Voice (Pop) - Platinum Medalist - Malaysia

Carmen Yee Sing Ying is 14 years old and was born in Sarawak, Malaysia. She started learning singing at the age of 6 . Carmen has participated in singing , speech , storytelling competitions and won several awards. In 2018, She was the 3rd runner up of the 5th Hongkong International Music Festival in Children Pop Voice Singing competition . In 2019, she has won the “Malaysia Top 10 Outstanding Star Award”and also has been chosen as Best Student in Co-curricular and Academic of SMK Chung Hua School. Carmen has won Gold Award in Asia Pacific International Arts Festival Singing competition in 2020. This year , Carmen is honoured to receive “Top 10 outstanding Vocalist” Award from Asia Pacific International Arts Festival. Besides singing, Carmen enjoys playing piano, guitar and ukulele ​

Catherine Yi-Ling Hung - Cello - Platinum Medalist - Taiwan

A big fan of classical music and ballet, Catherine participates actively in learning and growing opportunities surrounding performing arts. Her cello study started at age 9 under the professional guidance in school by Chia-Fen Chen. At the age of 14, she is currently under the guidance of Maestro Janet Chien. Catherine has also been coached by Maestros, Wen-Sinn Yang, Ben Hong, and Claudio Marini. She is the selected cello member for the school chamber music ensemble, and participated in piano trio, quintet, and string quartet. She is an active member of Taipei Philharmonic Youth Ensemble in the Orchestral sector as cellist. Through the years of cello study, Catherine has participated in some local and international competitions with great achievements ranging from competitions held around the world including the Canadian, American Youth Talent, Odin, Opus, and more. The passion for performing arts continues to sail in different courses, cello will always be one.

Eun Hyang Choi - Piano - Gold Medalist - USA​

She studied at the Saint Petersburg Conservatory in Russia and New York with Russian pianists( Vladimir poliakoff who studied with Gregory Sokolov) and Nina lelchuk who studied with Vladimir Ashkenazy, and Mihail Pletnev, the best Russian pianists in existence. Her musical roots and identity are heralded by the genealogy of ‘Cherny-Liszt-Zilotti-Igumnov-Polyer-Blysenko-Pletine’: from Beethoven to western Europe,the representative pianism of Russia. She has experience in playing in Russia, the United States, and Korea, as well as teaching and playing in Daegu, and she currently holds a degree in New York and is engaged in musical activities. She won the 5th Krystian Tkaczewski International Competition and the V Future Stars International Competition, and is currently performing in Russia, the United States, and Korea. She will continue her academic and musical careers with Professor Jerome Rose of Mannes (The New School) in New York.

Ludmila Pelahiy – Voice – Gold Medalist – Austria

Ludmila Pelahiy is studying at the International Academy of Music and Performing Arts Vienna. She is member of the OPERA-teens of the Vienna State Opera. Ludmila also performed in the Opera of Burg Gars. The young singer took part at numerous national and international competitions and festivals. Ludmila has been presented as a soloist with a Platinum Prize award at the Canadian International

Music Competition 2020-2021 and two Gold Prize awards – at the Grand Metropolitan International Music Competition 2021 and at the Quebec International Music Competition 2021. She is also prizewinner at the IInd International “Edelweiss” Competition-Festival 2017 and double prizewinner at the Viennese regional competition “Prima la musica”: 2009 in the category Vocal Ensemble and 2010 in the category Solo Singing. Ludmila has perfomed as a member of the OPERA-teens in the 6 th International Anton Bruckner Choir Competition and Festival 2017. The choir has been awarded with a Silver Prize. Ludmila took part at several gala concerts and festivals in Europe such as

the gala events “CGDC Award” 2012 and 2013 in Vienna, the “Junge Musik”-Concert of “Wien Modern”, the gala concert “Berühmte Opernchöre” with the Arnold Schoenberg Choir etc.

Ng Kun Kuen - Voice - Gold Medalist - Malaysia

Ng Kun Kuen, soprano, graduated with Bachelor of Music (Hons) Classical Music from University College Sedaya International (UCSI) Ng obtained her Licentiate Diploma Certificate (LTCL) in Vocal performance with Distinction in 2011 and was awarded both, with Distinction, the Associated Diploma (ATCL) and Performer’s certificate (PC) in Vocal performance from Trinity College London and Trinity Guildhall London in 2009 and 2008. Ng holds as well an Associated Diploma

(ATCL) in Piano Performance. In 2020, Ng also has been featured in Britishpedia (Successful People in Malaysia) 3rd edition publication from the British Publishing House Ltd.

Ng has won numerous international prizes among them the Gold Medal in 36th National Art Song

Singing Competition Regional Championship, Champion in the 42nd National Art Song Singing

Competition National Championship in 2016, Silver Medal in the 4th Hong Kong International Music

Festival Vocal Open Category in 2017 and the Outstanding Awards in the 43th Italy Teresa Belloc

International Vocal Competition Asia Preliminary in 2017. In 2019, Ng has won a champion in the

Taiwan International Classical and Traditional Music Competition Vocal Competition Chinese

language vocal work and a Silver Medal from the foreign Language Vocal Work Category. At the

same year, Ng also won an International Gold medal in the Vocal Open Category from the Ivy League

Education in Beijing, China. Besides, she is also a gold award winner in the Vocal Category of the

Grand International Music & Talents Festival. At the same year, Ng also awarded a China Beijing

International Outstanding Award 2019 from the Malaysia ( International ) Arts Festival.

Fei Xia - Voice - Gold Medalist - USA

Soprano Fei Xia is originally from China. She holds her Master of Music

degree in vocal performance from the University of Miami and Artist

Diploma from Montclair State University. She is currently pursuing her

Doctoral of Musical Arts degree in vocal performance at West Virginia

University where she is studying with Dr. Hope Koehler. She recently

won the First Prize in the 2021 “The Song” International Vocal

Competition, and the Third Prize in the 2021 North International Music

Competition. She also has won many national and international vocal

competitions, including V ODIN International Music Competition(2020

Honorable Mention); Metropolitan National Opera Council Audition

Florida District (2019 Finalist); Classical Singer National Vocal

Competition(2017 and 2018 Finalist); Music International Grand Prix

Vocal Competition(2021Semi-finalist); New York Lyra International

Vocal Competition(2018 Semi-finalist); and New York Lyric Opera Theater National Vocal Competition(2017 Semi-finalist). She was selected as the finalist of the New York MIA Opera Management and the

Spain Operars Management companies Roster Audition in 2020. Ms.Fei has been selected to be engaged with several professional opera companies, including Vienna Opera Festival, NYLOP, Angels Vocal

Arts Opera Company, Manhattan Opera Studio, Miami Classical Music Festival, Berlin Opera Academy, Connecticut Lyric Opera House Young Artist Opera Program, Taconic Opera Company Young Artist Program, and etc. In 2017, Fei made her Carnegie Hall debut as the role of Juliette in Roméo et Juliette with New York Lyric Opera. In 2018, she was

invited to perform again at Carnegie Hall, singing the role of Giulietta in Les contes d’Hof mann. She then performed the roles of Prima Cercatrice and Una Novizia in Suor Angelica with Montclair State University Opera in 2020. Besides the opera area, she also sang many oratorios from Bach, Handel, and Haydn. As an active recitalist, she

gave her several solo recitals in China and the US. As a voice teacher, she previously served as a voice teacher at Musipire Music Company from 2017-2018. She has taught students from early ages to adults. She built up her own private teaching studio in New York City in 2017.

​Junwoo Kim - Clarinet - Platinum Medalist - USA

​Junwoo Kim is a young clarinetist that has won prizes in numerous competitions.

Through instruction from Emily Coile, he was able to place first in both solo and ensemble playing in the Washington National Youth competition, Charleston International Competition, and the Potomac Valley Youth Orchestra Concerto Competition. He has also been a prize winner in the Virtuoso International Music Competition, YMIC International Competition and Metropolitan Classical Music Festival. In Maryland, Junwoo has been a part of the selective All County and Allstate Honors Band since 7th grade and was in the Allstate Band and assistant principal in the All County Band during his 9th grade year. Junwoo has been a part of PVYO for years where he has played as assistant principal in the Concert Band, principal in the Symphony Orchestra, and assistant principal in his first year of Philharmonia. In school, he was principal of Churchill’s Freshman Band and became section leader in his first year of Wind Symphony, the school’s most prestigious band. Junwoo also represented the New Life Philharmonic Orchestra as the principal clarinet.

Trying to find a way to contribute to COVID-19 relief, Junwoo has created the Metropolitan Youth Music Foundation where student musicians can record themselves playing classical or seasonal pieces! He then sends these videos to nursing homes for the elderly to enjoy. On the MYMF Youtube Channel, he has currently posted 30 videos and has 4 playlists with many more in the works!

Konstantinos Chrysostomou - Voice - Platinum Medalist - Cyprus

17-year-old Konstantinos Chrysostomou from Cyprus is no stranger to large

audiences. In 2012 he reached the finals after his successful participation in

ANT1 Greece’s popular televised talent show “Greece’s got talent”.

Konstantinos gave his first recital at the age of nine. As one of the child

prodigies of Ezekiel Elkin Konstantinos was selected to take part in the

international music summit “Wunderkindz” ,representing Greece in Buenos

Aires Argentina. His performance of the song “El sirtaki de Icaro” in Castilian,

is available on Spotify, published worldwide by Warner Music Group. He has

also performed at prestigious events including concerts organised by the

house of representatives during Cyprus’ presidency of the Council of the

European Union at the presidential Palace.

In December 2018 Konstantinos performed the role “The page of the Kings” in the Opera “Amahl and the Night Visitors”, a production by Kyrenia Opera where he was able to share the stage with well-known opera singers from the US in Europe. In 2021 Konstantinos has been awarded first and second prizes in many internatinal competitions: Angel Voice Classic (Belgrade) Grand Prix winner, Abanico Art Voices (Bulgaria) 1st prize, Rocky Mountain Competition (Canada) 2nd prize, Aphrodite Voice (Cyprus) 2nd prize and Québec Music Competition 1st prize Platinum Award. Konstantinos is a student at Pankyprio Odeon where he studied singing with Ellie Aloneftou for three years and since 2018 he continues his studies with Mariza Anastasiades.

​Estelle Bang - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

Estelle Bang is an active pianist in solo and chamber music recitals in and outside of the United States. She recently earned her Doctorate of Musical Arts degree in Piano Performance from Boston University, under the tutelage of Prof. Boaz Sharon. Prior to studying at BU, she received her Master's and Bachelor's degrees in Piano Performance and graduated summa cum laude from Seoul National University.

Dr. Bang was a recipient of several awards, including Di Bonaventura Scholarship, Lee Chrisman Scholarship, the First Prize in New York Artists International Competition, the First Prize in American Protégé International Piano Competition, the First Prize in Korean-American Cultural Foundation Competition, the First Prize in Music Education News Competition, the Second Prize in Laszlo Spezzaferri International Music Competition, the Second Prize in National Students' Music Competition, and Seoul Educational Chief Award. She was also a laureate for Schumann Festival and New Music Series: STUDIO 2021. As a member of Bon Piano Trio, Estelle was a winner of the Seoul National University Chamber Music Competition and has been invited to perform many chamber music recitals.

Recently she had a lecture recital focusing on "Literary Effects of E. T. A. Hoffmann on R. Schumann's Piano Music," and gave a lecture performance and master classes for "Beethoven Seminar on His 32 Sonatas." As a DMA candidate at BU, she performed at Boston University Concert Hall for the Celebrating Beethoven 250 Concert, Black History Month Concert, Claude Debussy Centennial Concert, The Golden Age of Harlem Stride Piano Concert, etc. (specially selected soloist). Dr. Bang will perform at Carnegie Hall this year for the American Protégé International Piano Competition Winner’s Recital, and will also be featured in a NYC recital of the Winner of the New York Artists International Competition next year.

Her passion for teaching has led her to serve as a Graduate Assistant at BU, where she teaches individual piano lessons and group classes for music majors and non-majors at the undergraduate and graduate level. Dr. Bang's additional studies include the master classes of Seymour Lipkin, Ian Hobson, Christopher Harding, Peter Bithell, Wen-Sinn Yang, Oliver Kern, Robert Roux, and Tali Morgulis among many others.

Aryanna Holmes - Violin - Solo and Ensemble Category - Platinum Medalist - USA

Aryanna Holmes is a full scholarship student at the Gifted Music School Conservatory in Salt Lake City, Utah, where she is currently studying violin with Eugene Watanabe. She will be attending Yale University in the fall as part of the class of 2025 with the intent of completing a double major in Music and Mathematics. She has won several concerto competitions and has had the opportunity to perform with The Salt Lake Symphony, The Southwest Symphony, and the Utah Valley Symphony. In 2020 she was named the winner of the Utah Symphony Youth Guild competition in both the Senior and Ensemble categories. Aryanna won the State Music Listening Competition (an academic music trivia competition) three years in a row, moving on to the National Competition all three years, where she placed 2nd Nationally in 2018, and 3rd Nationally in 2020. In 2021 she has been a 1st place winner at the New York Artists International Competition, the American Protégé International Concerto Competition, The Prima Volta Music Competition, The New York International Concours Competition, The Great Composers Competition in ‘The Music of Eastern Europe’, ‘The Music of Germany and Austria’, ‘The Best Grieg Performance’, ‘The Music of the Centuries:17th, 18th, 19th, and 20th century categories’, a recipient of the Gold Medal for the AADGT International Young Musicians festival, as well as a 2nd place winner of the American Protégé International Music Talent Competition. Aryanna will be performing at Carnegie Hall in November 2021, and has won two more additional Carnegie hall performances that are scheduled for 2022.

​Female Choir „Canzona – Absolwent” Murowana Goślina - Choir - Platinum Medalist - Poland

​Female Choir „Canzona – Absolwent” Murowana Goślina - Choir - Platinum Medalist - Poland

Conductor: Elżbieta Wtorkowska

The Canzona Absolwent ladies’ choir was established in the autumn of 2001. It is made up of former members of the Canzona girls’ choir. The choir takes part in events and gives concerts all over Poland and abroad. Here are the most important competitions and festivals Canzona Absolwent took part in:

- In 2003 the choir performed in Sweden at the International Music Festival in

Kristianstad.

- In 2004 it won the main prize at the 15 th Wielkopolska Choral Meetings in Koło.

- In 2005 it brought home a silver diploma and a distinction for performance of antique

music at the International Choral Competition in Barczewo.

- In the same year it won a bronze medal at the International Choral Competition in

Tampere in Finland.

- In 2006 it gained a silver diploma at the International Choral Competition in

Bratislava.

- In 2008 the choir won a silver medal at the 36 th International Choral Festival in

Olomouc in the Czech Republic.

- In 2009 it won a silver diploma at the 9 th International Choral Competition in Bad Ischl

in Austria.

- In 2010 the group received a silver award at the 17 th Yuzhnaya Palmira International

Choral Competition in Odessa, Ukraine.

- In autumn 2009 the choir appeared at the 9 th Biggar Little Festival and gave concerts

in Edinburgh, Scotland.

- In 2011 the choir took part in the 1st National Marian Song „Maryi Matce” in Poznań,

where it received the 3rd prize. The group also performed during the summer Vocal

Music Concerts „Varmia Gaudent et Cantat” in Ramsowo.

- In 2013 the choir took part in the Third International Choir Competition "Canco

Mediterrania" in Lloret de Mar, Spain, where the women won three Silver Diplomas

and third prize in the category of sacred music.

- In 2014 the ensemble was awarded two bronze diplomas and reached the finals by

achieving the 3 rd place in the Grand Prix competition at the International Choir

Contest in Freamunde, Portugal.

- In 2015 the choir received the 1 st prize at the 5 th International Chernomorski Zvutsi

Competition in Balchik, Bulgaria.

- In 2016 it gained 2 nd prize at the 5 th International Choral Competition “Music&Sea” in

Paralia, Greece.

- In 2017 the ensemble was awarded the “Honorary Diploma of Excellence” at the 23 rd

International Choral Competition on Malta.

- In 2018 the choir took part in a concert tour in the United States, giving

performances in New York City and in New Jersey.

- In 2019 the choir received the 2 nd prize at the International Choir Festival “Les voix de

la liberté” in Yvetot, France.

- In 2021 the choir received 1st and 2nd prize at International Youth Music Competition

(category Open) in Atlanta USA,the choir also won the 1st place at the 20th Choir

Festival in Bijeljina (Bosnia and Herzegovina), the 1st Place Diploma at the

International Music Competition in Moscow (Russia), the 1st Prize Diploma at the

Aphrodite Cyprus International Vocal Competition in Limassol (Cyprus), 2nd Place

Diploma at the 8th International Vocal and Choir Online Festival and Competition in

Kiev (Ukraine), Platinum Medal during the 5th edition of Quebec Music Competition

(Canada) and First Place Diploma during the 16th Creative Meetings Together in the

21st Century, Sophia invites the art of Faith, Hope and Love in Sofia (Bulgaria).

In 2007, the choir co-organized the Edmund Szymanski International Choral Meeting and

since 2008 it has been organizing the annual editions of the Edmund Szymanski

International Choral Festival in Murowana Goślina.

​The choir’s repertoire is based on the traditions of romantic, contemporary and folk song, as

well as popular music. The ensemble also performs early music. The choir’s founder and first

conductor is Elżbieta Wtorkowska, Professor at the Academy of Music in Bydgoszcz, and its

second conductor is Adrianna Wtorkowska-Kubińska, a graduate of the Academy of Music in

Poznań who has also completed a choirmaster’s qualification in Bydgoszcz. The choir’s

president is Aleksandra Ancan.

Roksana Puchniarz - Harp - Gold Medalist - Poland

Roksana Puchniarz is a 25 years old harpist and student of Grazyna and Kiejstut Bacewicz Academy of Music in Lodz (Poland) in the harp class of prof. Beata Tarnowicz-Kamińska. She began her musical journey at the age of 9 with the piano. Then, at the age of 16, she discovered her true love and passion, harp. Since then she has taken part in masterclasses with: Anneleen Lenaerts, Elżbieta Szmyt, Agnieszka Gralak, Joanna Kozielska. Roksana collaborates with the various orchestras in Poland and Czech Republic. She is a laureate of many awards at the international competitions: Kings Peak International Music Competition – Spring 2021 (2nd prize), International Music Competition Opus 2021 (3rd award), 5th Quebec International Music Competition (Gold Medal) and International Moscow Music Online Competition (2nd prize). Her second passion is Spanish language, she is also a student of master's degree in Spanish Philology at the Adam Mickiewicz University of Poznan (Poland).

Cantadivina Yu Yin Wong - Harp - Platinum Medalist - Hong Kong

Wong Yu Yin Cantadivina comes from a music-loving Hong Kong family. She began taking harp lessons at the age of three under the tutelage of USA International Harp Competition winner Ms. Dan Yu. Cantadivina is currently studying the harp under Ms. Ann Huang, who is the Principal Harp of the Hong Kong Sinfonietta and part-time harp lecturer in many tertiary institutions in Hong Kong.

​

Cantadivina had participated in many local harp and piano competitions with good results. In 2015, she competed in a harp competition in France as well as a harp and a piano competition in Italy. She was awarded the highest score in all three events. Then, she obtained the gold award in the 3rd Hong Kong Harp Competition 2015 Open Lever division. She obtained the first Prize of 2016 Grand Prize Virtuoso Competition International Music Competition in London, and the first prize in eMuse Competition organized by International Association of Art, "the Muse" in Greece. In November 2016, she went to Taipei and obtained the first prize of Taiwan Camac Prize 2016 in Open Lever Harp Youth Division.

She has extensive experience in performing on stage. She has been involved in several student recitals, community arts performances. She has also been invited to participate in Becky Lee's "A dream come true concert".

Thannapas Luanpitpong - Piano - Platinum Medalist – Thailand

10-Year-Old Thannapas Luanpitpong was born in Bangkok Thailand.

Thannapas started piano lesson when she was 3. She is currently a student of Dr. Pornphan Banternghansa and Dr. Christopher Janwong Mckiggan.

Thannapas has won numerous first prizes in several national and international music and piano competitions including

- the Platinum Medal in the Quebec International Music Competition 2021

- Brilliant Prize Winner of The 5th Brilliant Talent Discovery Awards International Music Competition 2021, Singapore

- First Prize Winner of Canadian International Music Online Competition 2021

- First Prize Winner & Best Etude Award of The UCSI International Piano Festival & Competition 2020 ,Malaysia

- First Absolute Prize Winner of 10th International Piano Talents Competition 2020 Milan,Italy

- First Prize Winner of 2020 Piano League Piano Star International Competition ,USA

- First Prize Winner of SEA Piano Competition 2020 , Malaysia

- First Prize Winner in The Royal Cup of Yamaha Thailand Music Festival 2020 For Electone Solo

- First Prize Winner in The Royal Cup of Yamaha Thailand Music Festival 2019 for Both of Piano Solo and Singing for kids

- First Prize Winner + Top Prize award of The Singapore Asia Youth Piano Competition 2019

- First Prize Winner + Top Prize award of The 6thMacao asia pacific youth piano competition 2019

- First Prize Winner of The 20thOsaka International Music Competition 2019, Japan for Piano Solo & Second prize winner for Vocal Musical Course Junior Category

- First Prize Winner of the 3rdSingapore international Classical Piano Competition 2019

- First Prize Winner of The American Protégé international Piano & string Competition 2018 ,USA

- Gold Prize of ADDGT “ Passion of Music “ 2018 , USA

- First Prize winner and Exceptional young musician special prize at Grand Prize Virtuoso International Music Competition 2017 ,Salzburg Austria

Currently at the age of 10, Thannapas is a Music Scholar student in Year 6, Primary Music Ambassador and Primary House Captain at Regent’s International School of Bangkok,Thailand and Thannapas also is a member of Mensa International Organization ( High IQ Society) as a gifted child with an IQ score of 143

Aside from Playing piano, Thannapas also excels in Chinese ,Japanese ,German, Song composition, Singing ,Cello , Violin, Electone, Ukulele and Guitar.

Zda Sumbillo - Voice - Gold Medalist – Philippines

Zda is a 10-year old consistent academic awardee and a winner in the 2018 Song Festival at her school. She is a two-time Gold Medalist - Voice in the 2021 Trinity International

Music and Quebec Music Online International Competitions. She was a bronze medalist, Rising Star Category - Voice in the 2020-2021 Canadian International Music Competition.

She recently got nominated as Best Performer in a Musical in Broadway World 2021 Awards for her first international musical performance in Lights, Stage, Sing Cabaret under

Broadway Everyday Star Theater (BEST). She and her BEST team won third place when they participated in the 2021 Eurovision Musical Contest 2 - representing Denmark in Inspiration Theater Co., UK. She had her first stint as a playwright and performed as Super Z (a superhero) in the Voices of Youth Theater Festival and won a Power Performer award in the Voices of Youth Talent Showcase by Powerstories in Florida, USA. Zda has a passion for music and the performing arts. She has played diverse roles in acting and was a work shopper at Atlantis Theatrical (AT), Repertory (REP), Trumpets Playshop, and ABS CBN-Star Magic. As a thespian, she was part of "online edition of The Big One-Oh!"; and portrayed Snitch, the fox in the Seven Little Penguins in REP on stage. She dreams big and loves to inspire people by sharing her talent for singing, dancing, performing, and the gift of sharing a story.

Lee Kan You - Piano - Gold Medalist - Malaysia

I am 14 years old, currently studying in the 2nd form of high school. I have been learning piano for 4 years from my teacher Mr Chris Chong. This is my first time taking part in an international music competition and I am glad for archieving a honorary award of GOLD. I am active in my school band and have been participated in many performance events throughout the years. I wish I could have more breakthroughs in my play and keep on the passion in playing piano as well as attempting in playing various types of music. I would also like to take this opportunity to give thanks to my teacher for his guidances and encouragements given. Thank you to my parents who giving me a lot of supports throughout the way. Last but not least, thanks QMC for giving me the stage to perform and granted me a valuable affirmation.

Aidan Loo - Piano - Gold Medalist - Malaysia

My name is Aidan Loo. I am from Malaysia. I started the journey of music at the age of four. It’s always a satisfaction to see myself progressing from no music background at all to being able to play songs I like. I have won gold prizes for both Grand International Music Festival Piano Competition and The 7th Hong Kong International Youth Performance Arts Festival in 2019. I also got silver for 2021 MIA Young Musician Competition. I understand that persistence is much of

what separates the successful from the pure wishful thinkers. I will not give up on my dreams to perform on stage. I am very honoured to have received a Gold award for my performance. I would like to give thanks to my teacher - Patrick Kong and Ms Chan Kit Yee for their guidance and encouragement given.

Rishika Goteti - Piano - Bronze Medal - USA

Rishika is currently high school freshman in New Jersey, USA. Since childhood she has been keen student and lover of of vocal and instrumental music.

Rishika has been learning Western classical Piano from accomplished teacher in NJ and won in many piano competitions. She has been invited to perform in prestigious concert halls like Carnegie Hall NY in 2017 and 2018, Massachusetts Institute of Technology Boston in 2019, Rockport Music performance center in Rhode Island in 2019 . She was also a winner in the International Indian Icon competition in instruments category.

Rishika is also learning traditional Indian Carnatic vocal music and participated and won many singing competitions in New Jersey organized by Indian cultural organizations.

Aside from music, Rishika is also an accomplished Academic student. She also loves to spend her time reading books and has been dabbling in writing books since middle school. Rishika plans to pursue her passion in music in the future and hopes to be an accomplished musician hopefully bringing cheer to the musical lovers around the world. Rishika is honored to participate in Quebec International Musical Competition and be part of the esteemed group of winners in the competition.

Jessandra Wong - Piano - Honorary Mention - Malaysia

Malaysian pianist Jessandra Wong adores a wide variety of exciting career opportunities. Jessandra is a full time pianist, vocalist and musician. As a chorale singer, Jessandra has competed and performed in choir competition, tour and festivals in Europe such as Croatia, Czech Republic while touring across Vienna, Prague and Hungary, and Asia such as Taiwan, Vietnam, Myanmar and Malaysia. In Europe, the choir has been awarded two Gold Prize awards in Karlovac, Croatia and Olomouc, Czech Republic. The choir has been voted Top 5 as an overall champion in Olomouc, Czech Republic. In Asia, the choir has been awarded Silver Prize award in Taipei, Taiwan and a Gold Prize award in Hoi An, Vietnam.

Furthermore, Jessandra has collaborated with the Dithyrambic Singers and Malaysia Philharmonic Orchestra (MPO) as a Soprano chorale singer. Jessandra is versatile in terms of vocal range, singing both Alto and Soprano ranges. Beautiful choral works include Beethoven’s Mighty 9th (2017), Malaysian Film Ola Bola (2017), Carl’s Orff Carmina

Burana (2018), Tchaikovsky’s Russian Queen of Spades Opera (2019) and Hironobu Sakaguchi Final Fantasy (2019).

As an enthusiastic pianist, Jessandra has been to numerous piano competition training grounds, and luckily she has been awarded Gold Prize award in Asia Pacific International Arts Festival, Bangkok International Piano Competition and 6th Hong Kong International Youth Performance Arts Festival. Jessandra has also been awarded Silver Prize award in Euroasia and Kota Kinabalu Music and Dance Festival. Jessandra has also been awarded Bronze Prize award in Singapore NIPA Piano Competition.

Jessandra has been able to improve on her music skills by going for masterclasses under Yulianna Rumiantseva, Dr. Eri Nakagawa, Dr. Murray McLachlan, Mr. Loo Bang Hean, and Hitomi Koyama. As a music educator, Jessandra constantly aims to innovate her music classes and make her classes accessible to the public for all ages and from different levels in music. Jessandra hopes that the public will grow to love music in different genres and find a type of music that they will enjoy playing everyday.

Leander Hennes Resch - Violin - Platinum Medalist - Germany

Leander Hennes Resch began to learn to play the violin at the age of five. He is instructed on the violin by Ms. Susanne Reiner and has coaching lessons from Mr. Dennis Kozarov. At the age of seven he appeared for the first time as a soloist with the Wissembourg Chamber Orchestra and made his debut at Carnegie Hall at the age of eight. In the meantime he has given concerts at such renowned locations as the Mozarteum Salzburg, Bozar Brussels, the Beethoven House in Bonn and open-air concerts in Italy. He has won several prizes and grand prizes at international competitions and has attended master classes with Prof. Viviane Hagner and the Notos Quartet, among others.

Vivian Nguyen - Piano - Platinum Medalist - USA

​

Vivian Nguyen, 11 years old, started playing piano since she was four years old. Currently, she is studying piano at Pleasanton Academy of Music in California, USA under the professional guidance of her teachers, Ms.Tatiana Kubatina and Dr. Alexander Lazarev. Vivian has achieved many notable accomplishments such as winning Grand Prizes and First Prizes at various competitions including New York Concert Festival International Competition, US Open Music Competition, US International Music Competition, and Music Through the Centuries Competition. One of her most memorable achievements was performing at the prestigious Carnegie Hall when she was nine years old as a Grand Prix Prize winner from the New York Concert Festival International Competition. She enjoys performing piano and listening to other talented musicians at competitions and recitals. Vivian appreciates a broad range of music styles and repertoires as each music period presents unique characteristics which she loves to explore and master.

Po-Hsin Chen - Piano - Platinum medalist - Taiwan

Po-Hsin Chen is 11 years old. He lives in a delightful countryside in central Taiwan. He started playing piano at the age of 6. He has taken private piano lessons with Miss Ling-Hsien Kuo since he was 9. Miss Kuo is an excellent piano teacher; who encouraged him to develop his talent for playing piano. He enjoys playing piano and now is a student in the sport talent class at Gukeng Elementary and Junior High School in Taiwan.

​

He loves music and always says “Piano is a good friend of his life”. In the past year, he successfully performed in piano competitions becoming the winner of 2020 International Music Competition Grand Prize Virtuoso (Bonn in Germany), Music@e-Contest Music Competition

Petlada Changkasiri - Violin - Platinum Medalist - Thailand

Petlada Changkasiri was born on September 2nd, 2017. She started her first music lesson with the Suzuki Early Childhood Education (SECE) and her first Suzuki violin lesson on the 10th of September, 2020. Studying violin for 8 months as of June 2021. She has been taking her violin lessons with Mr. Polyiam Palitponganpim at the Aum-Aree Music School, Thailand. This is her first competition competing in the Quebec Music Competition 2021.

Nora Blagojevic - Piano - Gold Medalist - USA

Nora Blagojevic is a rising 7th- grade student at Glenelg Country School in Ellicott City, Maryland, USA. She started playing piano at age five and was always praised for her emotional, creative performance, strong technique, and unique individuality. Nora won many awards at different regional and international competitions.

She was five times laureate at Maryland Piano State Festival 2016/2021.

Nora won at the following International Competitions:

Quebec Music Competition 2020 (HM),

Rising Talents Festival, 2019 (Grand Prize),

Elite International Music Competition 2020 (First Place),

Canadian International Competition 2020/2021(Second Place),

Crescendo International Music Competition 2020/2021 (Second Award),

American Protégé 2021(Third Place), and

Quebec Music Competition 2021 (Gold Medal).

Wong Tsz Kwan Harvey - Piano - Gold Medalist - Hong Kong

​Wong Tsz Kwan Harvey, 7 years old, a Primary One student in Hong Kong and also a student of the Hong Kong Academy of Performing Arts majored in Piano. Harvey started playing piano at the age of 4, and already completed the Grade 8 piano examination with Distinction at the age of 6. Harvey also plays violin and double bass too.

Harvey loves music! He enjoyed playing piano and is happy to share the joy of music through the various repertoires he plays. His favourite composers are Chopin and Mozart.

Prannatee Karnchanapoo - Violin - Gold Medalist - Thailand

​Prannatee (Keene) Karnchanapoo is now studying in year one at Shrewsbury International School Bangkok Riverside in Thailand. Keene is very passionate about playing violin, he also loves composing songs and dancing while playing violin. He has continuously been learning and playing violin since he was 4 years and 7 months old. Keene joined junior strings at school as the youngest member when he was 5 years old. He is now 6 years old and has always been enthusiastic and attentive when he is learning violin and watching the professional violin performance. He already passed the ABRSM level 1 with distinction, and he just received the Hope Prize Winner in Sugree Charoensook International Music Competition 2021.

Lee Chun Hei - Double Bass - Gold Medalist - Hong Kong

Jayden Lee, 6 years old, is a kindergarten student in Hong Kong. He has great passion in music. As an enthusiastic double bassist, Jayden has been actively participating in local and global competitions. Among these, Jayden has won Champions at Italy International Music Competition, International Young Musicians Music Competition, Wien and 11th IYACC International Music Competition, etc.

Currenly, Jayden is a member of the prestigious children's choir and symphony orchestra in Hong Kong.

Jade Man Huen Cheung – Piano – Gold Medalist - Australia

Jade Cheung, age 14, is a passionate music student from Melbourne, Australia. She started learning the Piano when she was in grade 1. Jade is blessed with the care and inspirations of her music teachers over the years.

Jade studies at Ringwood Secondary College where they have phenomenal music programmes and instructors. She is currently learning the Violin and the Oboe while pursuing her AMusA in the Piano.

​

Jade absolutely enjoyed the experience of this competition. She will continue to

participate in upcoming opportunities so more people can feel and hear her music.

Zhen Yu Lai - Piano - Gold Medalist - USA

Zhen Yu is 7 years old and resides in California, USA. He has been learning piano for 6 months under the guidance of Peyhwan Kuan. He likes playing piano because the amazing piano sound brings him joy and excitement.

​Zhen Yu won his first gold medal at the Quebec Music Competition 2021. It is a big encouragement for him to move forward. In his spare time, Zhen Yu enjoys gardening and playing pickleball. He also likes playing Legos. Zhen Yu is looking forward to meeting more talented pianists and sharing the fun that he has rewarded from playing the piano.

Tan Yan Kyle - Violin - Silver Medalist - Malaysia

I am 13years old, a high school student who passionate about music. I have been learning violin since I was 4 years old and had been taken part in several domestic and international music competition. I am glad for obtaining a honorary award of SILVER in QMC. I wish I could have more breakthroughs in my play and keep on the passion in playing violin as well as attempting in playing various types of music. Thanks to such a great encouragement from QMC and I have decided to pick up my second instrument - piano. I wish I could be a brilliant musician in the future. I would like to take this opportunity to give thanks to my teacher Mr Chris Chong for his guidances and encouragements given. Thank you to my parents who giving me a lot of supports throughout the way. Last but not least, thanks QMC for giving me the stage to perform and granted me a valuable affirmation.
